text: Potassium sulfite is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is K2SO3. It contains potassium and sulfite ions. ==Properties== It is a white crystalline solid. It is a reducing agent. It can react with oxidizing agents to make potassium sulfate. ==Preparation== It is made by reacting sulfur dioxide with potassium hydroxide. :2 KOH + SO2 â†’ K2SO3 \+ H2O ==Uses== It is used to preserve food. Sulfites can cause allergies in some people, though. ==Related pages== *Sodium sulfite *Potassium sulfate Category:Potassium compounds Category:Sulfur compounds
title: Potassium sulfite
